lead_paragraph: The Rangers promoted Jim Schoenfeld to assistant general manager. He replaces Don Maloney, who became general manager of the Phoenix Coyotes last month. Schoenfeld will remain the general manager of the Hartford Wolf Pack, the Rangers’ American Hockey League affiliate, a position he has held for four seasons.He will no longer coach the Wolf Pack; Ken Gernander was hired to replace him. Schoenfeld will be the assistant general manager for player personnel; Cameron Hope will serve as assistant general manager for hockey administration.“Our organizational philosophy is to build within, and Jim’s keen eye for talent at every level has proven successful in building our organization,” Glen Sather, the Rangers’ president and general manager, said in a statement.
